text: "My Woman's Good to Me" is a single by American country music artist David Houston. Released in January 1969, it was the first single from his album Where Love Used to Live/My Woman's Good to Me. The song peaked at number 4 on the Billboard Hot Country Singles chart. It also reached number 1 on the RPM Country Tracks chart in Canada. George Benson recorded "My Woman's Good to Me" on May 20, 1969 and included his version on the album Tell It Like It Is.Information on recording date taken from CTI album sleeve SP 3020 Benson's version, recorded in New York, charted in the lower reaches of the Billboard Hot 100.CTI Records discography accessed February 16, 2012 In the following decade it became popular in the United Kingdom on the flourishing Northern Soul scene. ==Chart performance== {|class="wikitable sortable" !align="left"|Chart (1969) !align="center"|Peak position |- |align="left"|U.S. Billboard Hot Country Singles |align="center"|4 |- |align="left"|Canadian RPM Country Tracks |align="center"|1 |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:1969 singles Category:David Houston (singer) songs Category:RPM Country Tracks number-one singles Category:Songs written by Billy Sherrill Category:Songs written by Glenn Sutton Category:Epic Records singles Category:1969 songs Category:George Benson songs Category:A&M; Records singles
title: My Woman's Good to Me
